section.section: On the form that the Commissioner provides, each nonresident applicant for a license must appoint the Commissioner as attorney for service of process issued against the applicant in the State.

The appointment:
is irrevocable;
binds the applicant and any successor in interest; and
remains in effect as long as there is in force in the State a contract made by the applicant or an obligation arising from a contract made by the applicant.

Each nonresident applicant for a license shall provide the Commissioner with the name and address of a resident of the State on whom notice and orders of the Commissioner and process issued against the applicant may be served.
A nonresident licensee promptly shall notify the Commissioner of a change in its designated agent for service.
A change is not effective until acknowledged by the Commissioner.
